abstract: Mr. Tramiel championed Commodore computers, inexpensive machines that were to personal computers what Henry Ford’s Model T was to automobiles.
snippet: Mr. Tramiel championed Commodore computers, inexpensive machines that were to personal computers what Henry Ford’s Model T was to automobiles.
lead_paragraph: Jack Tramiel, a hard-charging, cigar-chomping tycoon whose inexpensive, immensely popular Commodore computers helped ignite the personal computer industry the way Henry Ford’s Model T kick-started the mass production of automobiles, died on Sunday in Palo Alto, Calif. He was 83.

headline.main: Jack Tramiel, a Pioneer in Computers, Dies at 83
headline.print_headline: Jack Tramiel, a Pioneer in Computers, Dies at 83

abstract: As most large company do, MF Global bought insurance to pay for the expenses its employees might incur if they were investigated and found liable for actions taken while working for the firm. As unfair as it may seem, it is the company insurance that pays these legal costs, even in bankruptcy.
snippet: As most large company do, MF Global bought insurance to pay for the expenses its employees might incur if they were investigated and found liable for actions taken while working for the firm. As unfair as it may seem, it is the company insurance t...
lead_paragraph: When four top MF Global executives testified before a Congressional subcommittee on March 28 about how $1.6 billion in customer money went missing during the firm’s final days, they were accompanied by teams of lawyers. Care to guess who is paying for all that legal firepower?

headline.main: Footing the Bill for MF Global’s Lawyers
